title: Lutzburg's Champion Concepts Mega Thread
body:
http://i1298.photobucket.com/albums/ag47/Lutzburg/zaczvfs_zpsac376cbb.png

**MAJOR UPDATE**
After years of contributing on these forums, my hard work finally paid off and I'm now a Champion Designer on the League team!  Since our players are a curious bunch, many of you have already stumbled upon my fan work already.  Please note that while I'm able to reference my old creations in my day-to-day work, few if any of these ideas will ever actually be implemented into the game.  If nothing else, I encourage you to view this body of work as a testament to the power of hard work and dedication.  If there's something you want out of life, go and get it!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Introduction**
Hello, my name is Lutzburg! I'm a professional game designer and enjoy designing champions in my free time. Over the last three years or so, I have come up with over **70 unique concepts** in varying degrees of polish and completeness. As a professional in the game industry, I kept these designs private given the very slim chance that they might actually see some real world use someday. However, enough time has passed since I first created them and they've just been gathering dust on a 200+ page Google Doc. I think it's finally time I shared these ideas with the League of Legends community in the hopes that the community can both find inspiration in my work and also help me improve and continue honing my craft. Thanks for reading!

**New Releases**
[Ronin, the Shadow Soldier](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/kaZhzn6E-ronin-the-shadow-soldier)
[Rabadon, the Death Mage](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/dbp1iwNM-rabadon-the-death-mage)
[Melicent, Conduit of the Swarm](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/oZ0j37UL-melicent-conduit-of-the-swarm)

**Lutz's Top Picks**
Seeing a **+** next to a Champion on the list below indicates that it is one of my personal favorite concepts.

**Champion Index**

*Note: Some of the concepts you may read can be over three years old. The game has changed a lot in that amount of time, so some concepts may no longer be as relevant or novel as they once were, and some concepts have since been explored by official champions introduced into the game.*

> [{quoted}](name=Lutzburg,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=uuQxluoH,comment-id=0058,timestamp=2015-03-16T09:10:27.745+0000)
> 
> After over three years of designing, iterating and balancing, and having spent the last three months formatting, researching and publishing, I have AT LONG LAST completed all of my existing champion concepts.  From the bottom of my heart, thank you to everyone who upvoted, downvoted, praised me and criticized me throughout this process.  I owe a lot to each of you.
> 
> Over the next week or two, I hope to do one final pass on every concept by adding a "resource" section and moving my mega thread link to the top of the page, as well.  I'll also be spending a lot of time responding to specific feedback that I haven't had time to get to yet, most notably the infamous Echo concept.
> 
> After that I might relax for a bit, do some reviews of my own and see what happens.  That said, I don't intend to stop designing champion concepts any time soon.  I still have a lot more ideas and now that I'm all caught up, adding them one at a time should be a breeze.  ;)
> 
> Thank you again to everyone who has supported me through this project!
> 
> Good night for now,
> 
> -Lutzburg

replies.body:
**Personal Design Philosophies and Approach**

I believe I am a relatively well-rounded designer, though I have a stronger interest and emphasis on mechanics and flow of gameplay. I'm interested in lore, back story, dialogue, etc., but in the interest of time and effort required, few of my champions go deeply down that route. Instead, I have focused most of my effort on creating cohesive and fun kits that flow, have good counterplay opportunities and synergize both with itself and the rest of a team.

I also hold the belief that it's nearly impossible to predict how things such as damage, scaling, range, etc. (the hard numbers) will play out in the real game when the champion can't actually be tested. As such, my concepts are on the light side of the hard numbers and instead provide good frames of reference or baselines to get a rough estimate on the ability in question. For example, I'll often use adages like "similar in size to Anivia's Ultimate" in order to create a visual approximation for my readers.

I think it's very important to discuss design goals, philosophies and intended gameplay patterns whenever possible. This is why each of my champions are prefaced with a "General Design Philosophy" as well as brief design goals following each ability. These are important because they provide the context of WHY after the WHAT has been explained.

In addition, I always include a "Risk Analysis" section so that I can approach each concept from a business perspective. Would this champion be well received by the community? Does it push the envelope artistically, mechanically or thematically? If so, does it push too much? Are there technical limitations or overtly difficult implementation procedures that increase the difficulty of adding this character to the roster? I try to take all of these questions into account whenever I design a concept, because no matter how cool it is, it still has to be developed.

Finally, when it comes to naming champions, I always try to use interesting words that somehow relate to the core theme, personality or kit of that champion. Riot does an excellent job of this and it's actually one of the common weaknesses I see in many fan-submitted concepts. For example, "Brand" is a great name for a scorching fire mage and "Kog'maw" is pure perfection for an alien puppy dog who literally has bio-organic cogs in its mouth. If a champion's name has letters in the double digits, or more than one apostrophe, or can theoretically be pronounced in more than three ways, it's probably not a good name.

Hey man, I've been reading your concepts today and appreciate your design approach. I'm not a designer though, so I don't feel equipped to provide any intelligible, direct feedback. :P However, maybe there's something small I can share with you about how we analyze our champions that might be useful for you.

So, we think a lot about what it's like to play as a champion and establish a clear goal for that. Going further, we also think about what it's like to play with (this was a BIG DEAL during Kalista's development) or against that champion. Articulating those experiences help us understand what a champion contributes to the overall game. It's also useful in feedback sessions so people are aware of the expectations.

> [{quoted}](name=zero C00L,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=uuQxluoH,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-03-17T21:25:25.501+0000)

I feel like you guys missed a step here.

These seem really cool and pretty good, some complex, but they would still be interesting to play as/with/against. I was wondering if you could work on a concept I had come up with a long time ago. The concept I had started with was Lady Justice, a blind woman with a set of scales and a sword. Here is the link: http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4707958&highlight=blind+maiden I would really appreciate it if you could actually flesh it out and make something brilliant. At least take a look at it and tell me what you think of it, please.

Thanks so much for your feedback!  I have a HUGE backlog (50 champions or so) that are all designed but need to be formatted and added to my Mega Thread, so creating new champion concepts might not be the best idea for me right now, haha.  That said, your theme sounds really interesting so I'd like to dive into it and see what I can do with it.  :)

> [{quoted}](name=Lutzburg,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=uuQxluoH,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-01-02T06:29:32.617+0000)

Okay I checked out your page and I'm definitely intrigued.  My main concern is this:

By using a reward mechanism that shifts between two ends of a spectrum can lead to some very unfun gameplay.  For instance, what if the Maiden is nearly full of her "guilty" resource and suddenly an ally needs to be healed?  She either has to give up her progress towards being guilty or straight up refuse to heal her ally.  This is an interesting idea for a single player game, but I don't think it will work for League, specifically.

What if, instead, all of her abilities kept their full power during normal circumstances, and she had two "progress bars" representing Innocence and Guilt, as you designed.  However, these bars start in the center of her resource bar and ONLY move outwards; when she casts a spell of innocence, that side of the bar fills towards the far left side, and casting a guilty spell pushes the guilt bar towards the right.  This can take between 3-12 spell casts of each type, depending on how powerful or Ult-like you want the rewards to be for filling each bar.

In my head, it makes sense for this to be on the level of Karma's Mantra, at a roughly 20-40 second dynamic cooldown through basic spell rotations.  Filling a bar all the way would then augment the next cast of a spell that fit the guilt or innocence category, respectively.  I think this is what you were going for in the original design, yes?  Then she can stance dance between her two forms rather frequently (every 2-4 seconds) and raise one of her two scales up accordingly as part of a visual cue that she is in a particular stance.  The scales could even have a white and black flame burning in each one, and her spells could be inspired by this holy and dark energy.  Perhaps she even gets a sort of "yin yang" super ability if she manages to max out both ends of her resource bar within a short time of each other.

As far as basic abilities, let's think about words that could be thematically descriptive of her character- judgement, fairness, justice, blindness, truth, pursuit of knowledge, conviction, protection of the innocent, unwavering....

Using those words and then mapping game mechanics on top of them, I am envisioning abilities like...

* A passive component that increases the Maiden's tenacity
* A targeted ability that "judges" the actions of the marked target for a few seconds, followed by an effect based on their actions
* Something that deals true damage.  I mean come on, you could even call the ability "Truth Seeker" or something like that.  This stuff writes itself.
* A heal of shield that increases in power based on how weak or close to death the target is
* A "path of light" style ability that shows the pathing of enemy champions over the last few seconds (similar to Rek'sai's tremors passive, but rather than showing where they are, it shows a path that they recently took; perfect for tracking down stragglers trying to flee through the jungle)

What do you think?  Is that enough to get your creative juices flowing?

Thanks for the feedback and I understand fully well that you have a lot to do with your own champ concepts. I like what you suggested for the resource bar and augmenting an ability. For the "Judgement" I can see that working easily when used on an enemy, if the enemy attacks they get dealt some of it back (along the lines of retribution), maybe for ally cast it increases the amount of damage they deal (conviction). I'll definitely have to brainstorm on this and see what I can come up with.

Also, do Penumbra, the Noxian Spymaster.

I love assassins and I am interested how you tie this into lore because talon is one of my favorites.

Nice, good suggestion!  Penumbra is kind of a badass.  I toyed with him having a sort of cyanide capsule hidden in his tooth at one point.  I really wanted to explore the spy element.
Constantine and Flint have been added to the roster!  I'm changing gears slightly and focusing on Klaus next, as it was a request of some other forum-goers earlier today.

Hmmm... "*Reaper*" is such an overdone term to describe slashy monster things, in my opinion.  Plus it sounds more brute-force'y than I had imagined Roh' to be based on your description.  Up to you, of course!

Well Lutz, here it is! Roh'zix: Seeker of the Void. You made a very solid point about Reaper being used to mcuh. It took some thinking, but I think  Seeker gives a sense of mystery to him.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/19PrEx8a-champion-concept-rohzix-seeker-of-the-void

Hello Lutzberg! I just tried out your random champ generator, and while it took me a few tries to find something that works, it eventually gave me a mixed damage void assassin with a targeted ability that deals a slow and percent health damage.

Thus, I came up with Roh'zix, or Kha'zix's brother. Whereas Kha enjoys diving head first into the fight, and killing anyone he sees, Roh lures his enemies in and waits for the most opportune time to attack.

So far, I only have two abilities for him, his passive (which lays out a healing pick up that enemies can actually use), and his E (which is basically Yasuo's E, but slows, deals percent health damage, and increases the amount of damage his auto attacks deal to the target).

What do you think?

> [{quoted}](name=PG Electro522,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=uuQxluoH,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2015-01-03T21:50:05.636+0000)

Electro, thanks so much for using my generator!  That really means a lot to me.  From my point of view, half of the fun is getting dealt a really weird and seemingly broken set of rules.  It forces you to work inside of a box, then break out of it in really creative ways.  That is how [Yura's](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/r9aJJyGt-yura-winters-herald) Ultimate came about, and I think it's one of the most fun and unique abilities I've created so far.

Roh'zix sounds really neat so far!  I love the concept of a hunter that isn't as outright strong as his prey, so he has to outsmart them instead.  I can't help but think of an angler fish or venus fly trap, with the health relic sitting tantalizingly close to bait in opponents to go for it.  That's wickedly smart!  I would love to see the finished kit, and highly encourage you to continue to pursue the concept of Roh'zix, the Deceiver.  ;)

Computer programming is 100% the way to go if you're even remotely interested in it.  Programming gives you a better shot at becoming a game designer than purely studying to become a game designer, as counter intuitive as that sounds.  Plus, programming is a hard skill (as opposed to game design, which is a soft skill), and that hard skill can be utilized in dozens of other fields, if you need it to.

Hey guys!  Here is a little teaser preview of my latest Champion concept:

_**Melicent, Conduit of the Swarm**_

Imagine this...

http://i1298.photobucket.com/albums/ag47/Lutzburg/ripley_by_ertacaltinoz-d36uex2_zps5dqyikx4.jpg

...hooked up to this:

http://i1298.photobucket.com/albums/ag47/Lutzburg/tumblr_ng9o1lWOUk1remlbjo1_1280_zps29yyxsq5.png

Melicent is an entomologist (a fancy word for a bug scientist) who travels around Runeterra in a massive mechapede, collecting samples and performing strange experiments on her insect specimens.

I am finalizing her kit now, which will allow me to move on to various design philosophies, lore and general polish of the concept.  She's likely still a week or more out, but I'm confident enough in the direction now that I thought a preview wouldn't hurt anything.

Let me know what you think!

Mind if I ask a few questions? You seem like a really cool dude:

* What games/projects have you worked as a professional game design? 

* Your favorite champion concept that **you have made**?

* Your favorite champion concept that **isn't yours**?

I like to get to know the other champion concepters around boards :)

> [{quoted}](name=Flintfall,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=uuQxluoH,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-01-02T04:59:37.330+0000)
>
> Mind if I ask a few questions? You seem like a really cool dude:
> 
> * What games/projects have you worked as a professional game design? 
> 
> * Your favorite champion concept that **you have made**?
> 
> * Your favorite champion concept that **isn't yours**?
> 
> I like to get to know the other champion concepters around boards :)

Hey, thanks so much for showing interest!  I'm happy to answer any questions you're curious about.

1- I have been a professional game designer for 7 years now (since I was 20 years old) and got my start at a studio called Simutronics Corporation.  They're best known for developing the Hero Engine, which is being used by Bioware's SW:TOR, and their text-based MMO's DragonRealms and GemStone.  While I was there, I designed a comedy MMO RPG called Fantasy University, a tower defense gamed called Tiny Heroes, an endless runner called One Epic Knight, and several other projects that never saw a release.  After that I moved out to CA at a studio called Cie Games (now a part of Glu Mobile), where I worked on an online drag racing game called Racing Rivals (which has over 20 million players and has been the #1 racing game on the mobile market for the last 11 months).

2- That's the age old "which is your favorite child?" kind of questions!  I can only narrow it down to my top 3- Atlas, Verica and Rafa (who I haven't released yet).  Ironically of all the Champion roles, I am most pleased with my Marksmen as a group across the board.  I say it's ironic because Marksman is my least played and least favorite role in League.  I have to imagine the reason why they're my favorites is because I tried to make each one of them different and unique from any of the ADCs in League today.

3- I love champion kits that flow and synergize with themselves.  You look at five moves and go, "Wow, that works with this and using that springboards you into being able to use that!"  Those are my favorite.  The best examples of this, in my opinion, are **Leona**, **Morgana**, Olaf, **Galio**, **Blitzcrank**, Lux, **Orianna**, **Rek'Sai**, Riven, **Skarner** and **Urgot**.  I went ahead and bolded the ones I frequently play.
